inn1.comm: flighted on and around off stump, brings Simmons forward into a drive to the covers
flatter and shorter and he's spotted it extremely early, rocked back and drilled it through extra cover. Put away with considerable strength
better there, and the captain agrees from behind the stumps. Flighted on off stump and pushed to short cover
brings down an angled blade to a flighted delivery on off stump
a little straighter and Simmons has tapped it to mid-on
full face of the bat to answer this one that was given some air on middle, Long-on gets a look in

back of a length on off stump, Simmons stood up tall and punched back down the pitch. He set off straight away, but Gayle was ball-watching before getting on his bike. The fielding though wasn't quite sharp enough at mid-on to pose a threat
pushes it full on middle, cramps Gayle up and forces him to a push down the ground.
not as keen on the front foot but Mortaza's length doesn't give him much choice. Gets an inside edge to deep fine leg
Goes back and across and blocks a shortish ball on the stumps
Stays on his crease and opens the face of the bat to negotiate a shorter ball on off stump
Plays around a fuller ball on middle, should've been forward. A little nip in makes him miss his flick and strikes on the pads. Appeal from Mortaza, but that would've slid down leg
fuller and angled across the left-hander, Gayle lets it pass through to the keeper
a little shorter and Gayle punches to short cover, very crisp sound off the bat.
pushes him back with a shorter length, but this time there is no room. Gayle realises that and blocks
lovely line there, teasing along the fifth-sixth stump and Gayle refuses the play
pulls his length back a touch, but his line is quite probing. Pitching on off and straightening just a touch. Gayle, as he normally is so early in the knock, stays watchful and leaves
finds a good length but the angle across him was evident enough to be left alone quite comfortably
shortish on middle, Simmons gets up on his toes and taps back to the bowler

far too soon for those kinds of shots, even if the pitch seems terribly inviting to the batsmen. Simmons, slotted in to open for the first time for the series, rushes down the pitch and goes for the heave ho. Miscues it and offers a skier to mid-off
fullish on middle and leg, Gayle steps forward and blocks
shortish on off stump, Gayle stands up tall and punches to mid-off
targeting the top of off stump and Gayle is forced to protect it
tucked away through midwicket, but there is protection in the deep.
spraying this wide across the big left-hander as he can't be coaxed into chasing this one
shifts the line a bit closer to the batsman, but still going across him, as Gayle stands tall to defend this away to the off side
just silken from Gayle as he waits on this length ball on middle and off before pushing this gently past the bowler to the straight boundary for four
gets solidly behind this length ball on middle and off as this is punched away to mid off

and Al-Amin gets his man as he bowls one on a fantastic line as this just shapes away from Gayle on a middle line, with the batsman guilty of hanging his bat as the ball catches the outside edge to offer a simple chance behind to Mushfiqur, who snaps it up gleefully. Al-Amin is pumped and Bangladesh are sniffing some early blood here
short of a length outside off as Ramdin shoulders arms
right on target as this is pitched up on middle, with Darren getting behind this one comfortably
short of a length going across the batsman as this one is allowed through to the keeper
length ball going across as Darren cannot be tempted into going for the drive
looking to play this fuller one going across him in front of square on the leg side, but instead mishits it as the ball rolls harmlessly towards the off side
content to just fend this fuller one away to the off side
too full from Mortaza as Darren looks for the drive square off the wicket through the off side, but can't get it past the fielder at point, who puts in a dive to cut it off from going behind him
honing on the pads as Darren, who should have clipped this off the pads, instead digs this out towards the off side, and is able to sneak a run before the ball reaches mid off
Ramdin gets forward to defend the ball that is pitched outside off
this short of length delivery keeps a touch low, Ramdin handles it well though
hits just short of a length, thuds into Ramdin's bat as he defends off the back foot
gets back and makes a touch of room for himself to slap into the covers
fuller and angled across him, Bravo likes that though as he gets forward and flays to short point.
tucks him up on middle and leg, Bravo works it to short midwicket
pitched fuller on off stump, Bravo eases it down to mid-off. No single there
whack! That's been dismissed. A little too full and Bravo enjoys a full swing of the arms and enjoys a one-bounce for to long-off. Stunning

he's pierced the gap in the off side ring! There was short point, there was short cover, there was orthodox cover and all of them could only watch as he went on the back foot and drilled it to the boundary
shortish and has enough width for Ramdin to steer towards point, might have waited a little more to beat that man
fuller on and around off stump, Ramdin is forward with a push to mid-on
straying on the pads and Ramdin helps himself, seemed just a push through through midwicket but his balance and timing were near-perfect. Small boundaries help too
eyes lit up as he saw width on a fuller ball outside off, went for a booming cover drive but was a little too eager as he meets the ball too early and inside edges it
fullish and just outside off, tapped off the front foot to cover
chopped a shortish ball around the off stump, that time he waited long enough to beat point
skids on after pitching on a good length to rap Ramdin on the pads, but that would have headed down leg. Good start
cut from off stump, but Ramdin has struck it quite well. Rocked back, as far as he could go, made a touch of room to free his arms and benefits with three runs
stays back to a shortish ball and blocks, not much turn there, Mushy shouts, "lets not let it go"
flighted on middle and leg, Bravo goes for the sweep but can't connect
looped up on middle and Bravo is drawn into a forward defensive

oopsy! Captain is disgusted with himself as he misses a stumping. Lovely flight from the bowler, and it caused the mistake as Bravo danced down the track. Had him feeling for it, overestimated the turn and should have been gone. But Mushfiqur fumbled it.
gets back to whip a flatter ball from middle to midwicket
punched down the ground to escape strike
flighted on leg stump, Bravo puts his bat in front of pad

huge appeal from behind the stumps, but it seems to have come off the leg of Bravo. This was pushed through and Bravo was looking to work it with the angle, from around the stumps, but doesn't hit bat
shortish and has enough room for Bravo to swat it through the covers
flighted on off stump, driven with the full face of the bat
bye-bye ball! Sunk down on one knee and pummels a length ball, with the wind, well over the midwicket boundary. Looks like Ramdin has decided to upset the spinners
much quicker is this one and Ramdin is not quite prepared for that. Struck on the pads, but going down
pushed through on leg stump, Ramdin is a little more ready for this as he whips to deep square leg
not quite sure whether to come forward or back, hurries into a defensive to a good length ball on off stump
a little straighter and Bravo is far more confident tucking to midwicket
venture a little too far down leg there and is lucky not to have been swept to the boundary, as Bravo was planning
flighted on off stump, pushed towards mid-off
slower through the air and tosses it up a little more, Bravo blunts it with a dead blade and has defended soft enough to pinch a single
flighted on middle, pushed back at the bowler
fires it in on a length on off stump, Ramdin makes some room to cut off his stumps. Risky, but his timing seems to work for him
flighted on middle and leg, kept out safely
gets back and punches a good length ball through to long-off. Good footwork there from Bravo
touch too short and Bravo makes it worse with some smart footwork, makes room to slap it through the covers and the sweeper has too far to cover on his left
pushed through on middle and Bravo skeeps to his crease and defends
taken from off stump and its a straighter bat that comes down to collect another boundary through the covers. Exquisite hitting from Bravo
that's an outside edge as Bravo pokes from the crease, but there aren't any slips to assist him
flatter and fuller on leg stump, Ramdin isn't ready for the extra pace again
flighted on middle and leg, turned away to short midwicket
tossed up on middle and off, Bravo is forward to block and gets an inside edge onto pad. Mahmudullah hopes it pad before bat as he launches into an appeal, but its the other way around
good length ball on and around leg stump, defended
brings him forward, but Bravo's defensive blade is solid enough
short and wide, but Bravo was falling down leg and only bottom edges it down to long-off
flighted and angled in on off stump, Ramdin taps it back to the bowler
lovely flight and drift outside off, but Ramdin lunges forward and drops it towards point
finds a good length on middle and leg, Ramdin backs away and punches down the pitch
flighted on leg stump, Ramdin keeps his front leg away and blocks
invites the cut shot again and Ramdin is not shy of lacing it through point, bounced short of Nasir, but he could have got his body behind it
swept from a length and it beats short fine leg, that's the fifty stand. West Indies needed that and again, it is Ramdin who's getting them back on track
keeps it nice and tight on off stump, Ramdin can only block
flighted on off stump, Ramdin gets to the pitch and drives back at the bowler
tosses this one up on middle as Bravo stretches forward to defend this to the off side
whisks this fuller one on and around off to the leg side for a comfortable single
manages to tuck this one away on leg stump behind square on the leg side for one
displays how a forward defensive shot should be played
once again shows a picture-perfect example of his front foot defense
defended manfully by Darren towards mid off as the drinks cart rolls its way onto the field
width on offer by Mortaza straightaway as Ramdin is able to drive this one behind square, beating the converging third man fielder to the boundary
in the same channel as before, with the line a tad closer, as Ramdin opens the face to dab this down to third man, with the ball eventually intercepted by deep backward point
gets slightly forward to tuck this length ball on the pads away to mid on
manages to get Mortaza away to the man at long on with one that cramps Ramdin for space
honing in on the pads as Darren eases this away off his pads for a single
punched down the ground past mid off as long on comes round to field the ball
spinning sharply into Ramdin as he gets on the back foot to punch this past a diving Mahmudullah for a single
tossed up on middle and leg as Darren creates room to work this away to long on
backs away slightly to this fuller one on middle as he whips this to long on
fullish on the off stump, Bravo defends off the front foot

Darren uses his feet expertly as this one is bowled on a flatter trajectory on middle and leg, with Darren quickly getting under it to lift this high over long on for a huge six. This one just sailed into the stands as he timed it superbly
demonstrates some finesse this time as he rocks back to cut away Mahmudullah to the man at sweeper cover
this one clips Darren on the pads as Mortaza goes up for the appeal, but umpire Kettleborough is not interested as he ambles over to his left to signal leg bye

short of a length outside off and Ramdin almost gifts his wicket away as he goes for a half-hearted swipe across the line, with the ball carrying high in the air before falling just in front of the man coming in from long on, who doesn't want to go for the dive as the ball falls just in front of him. Was definitely a 'take-able' catch. Mortaza is more than furious. Abdur Razzak was the guilty culprit.
short of length delivery just outside off stump, punched off the back foot

length ball on middle and off which rears up a little on the batsman as this is defended back to the bowler, with Mortaza diving to his right on his follow-through to field the ball. Also his way of showing Abdur Razzak, who messed up the earlier chance, as to how to go about it
hangs back and pushes the short of length delivery to cover

short of a length and on the pads as this slower ball succeeds at tricking Darren, who is late on the ball as it thuds into the pads. Mortaza thinking about appealing, but this was definitely going down the leg side
Darren inches forward before getting low to defend this Mahmudullah special
Darren shows off some nifty footwork to glide down the crease before employing his front foot defense to good effect

gets onto the back foot to punch this away through the covers, but the fielder stationed near there is able to get to it quickly as Darren advances down the track for a run, but doesn't pick it up cleanly as the bobble allows for Darren to return to his crease and avoid a potential run-out situation
honing in on his stumps as he gets in front to defend
allows the ball to spin away and defends well
flatter outside off stump, punched to cover

and he is greeted to the crease with a huge six as Ramdin sees the opportunity to utilise his slog sweep to lift Gazi into the stands at cow corner. What a way to be introduced back to the bowling crease!

and Ramdin brings up his fifty in glorious style as Gazi once again tosses it up, allowing Ramdin to get under it to play a carbon copy of the previous shot, with the ball this time landing in the midwicket stand. Back-to-back sixes will certainly the WI' cause
thought he might make it three out of three but he crouches low to defend this one
manages to get away Gazi down the leg side as this is whipped away behind square
goes round the wicket to Darren who almost succeeds at chopping this on as he looked for room to cut the ball away
now it's Darren's turn to join the fun as another tossed up delivery is sent down the ground, this time with a beautifully timed hit by the left-hander
softly taps the flatter delivery to cover
advances and defends this flighted delivery to backward point
spinning in from outside off as Ramdin backs away to cut this just behind square for a brace. Good running there by the pair
brings up the 100-run partnership between these two with a gently eased single down to long on
advances down the track but the spin beats him as he retreats to the safety of the batting crease
gets nice and low to take out the malice of this latest Gazi offering
looks for the extravagant drive through extra-cover, but instead finds the fielder on the ring
changes his approach this time by attacking the covers, which sweeper cover eventually picks up
splayed down the leg side by Razzak as Darren looked for the big sweep. Called wide by the umpire
once again gets into position for the sweep, but only succeeds at getting this down to deep fine leg
flatter delivery outside off stump, Bravo cuts it to short cover
once again wide down the leg side as Razzak looks to bowl it tight on a leg stump line
slowed this up and dragged the length back, even though Bravo came down the track, he could only fend it
Bravo defends the flighted delivery into the leg side despite advancing down the track initially
goes deep in the crease and guides the flatter delivery into the off side
too short from Mahmudullah as this is cut away to the man at sweeper cover

pitched up by Mahmudullah as Darren becomes the 18th West Indian batsman to complete 2000 ODI runs with this lovely six over long on. Just danced down a bit before lifting Mahmudullah into the stands. Very Lara-esque that last one
softly turns it into the leg side, but can't sneak a run
waits for the ball to spin away before defending
bit of drift into the left-hander on this flighted delivery, driven straight to cover
Ramdin employs the sweep as this one is played away behind square on the leg side
and that single eased down to long on brings up the fifty for Darren Bravo, his 17th in this format. West Indies will want both these batsmen to press on for huge hundreds.
fired down the leg side, easy call
not much room for this back foot punch through the covers, but Darren manages to engineer some as this one just flies away to the boundary. Classy shot that from Darren
not much room for this back foot punch through the covers, but Darren manages to engineer some as this one just flies away to the boundary. Classy shot that from Darren
punched away to long on for one
short ball on leg stump as this is punched off the back foot down to long on
flighted delivery on the off stump, Ramdin pushes it to backward point
gets a thin edge to short fine leg
flatter on the off stump, defended into the leg side
short on the off stump, pulled well by Ramdin, but the fielder at midwicket makes a diving save
shortish outside off stump, punched back to the bowler, but Gazi fumbles
finishes off the over with a cut to the man at point
begins with one on middle which is punched away towards sweeper cover

tossed up in the slot as Darren has been lapping up this length all day, this time punishing Mominul by hitting him down he ground through long on for another huge six. Another wonderful Calypso shot from Darren Bravo
Mominul lucky to get away with that one as this time he pitches on middle and in the same slot, but Darren can't quite middle this one as the ball lands close towards long off
flighted delivery on the leg stump, Ramdin pushes it to long on
Mominul is slowly getting a sense of deja vu as this one is pitched once more in the zone as Darren is able to get up and under it to lift this into the long on stand for six

ends the over in style as this time Darren hits a bit flatter through the same region, with Razzak coming round from long on to field it, but doesn' t put in the dive that may very well have made the difference in saving a couple of runs. Lazy effort once more from the Bangladeshi tweaker
Ramdin backing away to create room to pull Gazi through midwicket, but can't get the spinner away
drags this one a bit to the leg side as Ramdin punches to long on
on the back foot as he looks to caress this away through the off side, with sweeper cover fielding the ball
once again steps out to the leg side as he looks for the cut through the covers
eased down to the fielder at long on for a single
this one rushes the batsman slightly as he brings his bat down in time to fend this away to the off side
full delivery on the leg stump, Bravo flicks it to mid-wicket
looks to on-drive but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
good length delivery on the off stump, Ramdin defends into the leg side
slower delivery on the off stump, Ramdin defends
full delivery on the off stump, Ramdin drives it to long off
slower delivery just outside off stump, Bravo defends it to mid-wicket
flatter delivery on the leg stump, Ramdin punches it to long on
drives this flatter one back to the bowler
drifting in and spinning away, driven to long off. 150 partnership up
flighted delivery on the off stump, Ramdin sweeps and gets an inside edge to backward square leg
flatter delivery on the leg stump, punched to long off
good length on and around off stump, punched to long-off
just a little too much width on offer and Bravo lashes it through the covers off the back foot. He's milked that region
pulls the pace off the ball, which is short and pushes Bravo back. Defended with an open face on leg stump
picked away off his pads, simply done with square leg vacant
offers up a length ball and Ramdin has launched it over the sight screen. Magnificently played
slower ball again, but it's been spotted and considering it had some width, Ramdin only needed to steer it away to the sweeper
he tries to cramp the batsman up on leg stump, but his length allows Ramdin to sweep past the right of short fine leg
goes back and turns a good length ball along the ground through square leg
good length ball, coming on with the arm to middle. Punched to extra cover
tossed up on off stump, Bravo eases forward to defend
pushed down the ground to long-off as he reaches the pitch with a solid front foot stride
this angle is not working, Ramdin has positioned himself outside leg stump and launches the flighted ball over the long-off boundary. This is getting to be too easy for West Indies
targeting leg stump again, but Bravo is able to tuck it through square leg
fired in on middle and leg, Ramdin tries an inside out drive through the covers but ends up with a single through square leg owing to an inside edge
worked away along the ground to deep square leg. Those singles have been a lot more apparent in this innings
steps outside leg to drive through extra cover, but the off side ring does not yield this time

a little shorter and a little quicker, Ramdin sets up for the cut but it comes off the deck too quick for him. Gets a thick outside edge that saves him from being bowled, and to add to the bowler's misery, it goes to the third man boundary
that was a poor ball, still too short and too flat and Ramdin pulls off the cut in far more convincing fashion. Beats point, but not the sweeper
flighted on off stump, kept out solidly
brings him forward again, not too many times has that happened. Bravo is content with a defensive

that's what's been happening all innings, the spinner bowls short, the batsman rocks back and picks his spot. This time Bravo favours deep midwicket and away it sails... right onto a fan who was trying to catch it
corrects his mistake and gives the ball a bit of air, Bravo gets forward to block
backs away and cuts through the covers
eases forward to defend a tossed up ball on middle and that will bring us to the drinks break
a slower ball around the off stump, chopped to the right of short third man for a quick single
backs away and drills a fuller ball down to long-off
back of a length and cramping Ramdin, who is up on his toes to tap into the midwicket region
short and wide, it's been scythed but point is in the way. Good work from Mominul
meets the slower ball with an angled face and drops it in front of point. Ramdin knows the play and rushes to complete a quick single

is that something? The umpires convene to discuss. Has Ramdin gloved behind? Has it carried to the keeper? Another slower ball from Mortaza, but this time seemed to bounce a touch more than the batsman expected. Ramdin wanted to cut it off the stumps but may have ended up botching himself off a well-deserved century. Oh, not quite... The replays show the ball has bounced before Mushfiqur dived forward to take it
chopped away off a good length to point
quick, flat and homing in on off stump, Bravo has good hands as he cuts to cover.
flighted on middle and leg, kept out capably
backs away and pummels the length ball through the covers, but the man close-in dives to his left to stall it's progress
tapped down the ground as he meets the ball where it pitches
backed away and slaps a length ball, with a bit of an open face to point
back of a length on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
fuller on off stump, Ramdin is forward with a dead bat. Has a wry smile as he walks up to his partner to take a little time out of the game and calm himself

short and wide, that's his bread and butter as Ramdin cuts and pierces the gap perfectly. That's his second ODI ton and he has placed his team in a commanding position. Came in at a dicey time and turned it around brilliantly
clears his front leg and hammers a length ball over extra cover. Loaded up with a big back lift and the six-hitting spree continues in St Kitts
another one! This was short on middle, Ramdin goes the other way although he didn't really connect as well. Hit it a touch high on the bat, but has powered it away over cow corner
seeks the yorker, but it isn't forthcoming. Ends up overpitched and Ramdin brings down a full face and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Look out in the crowd!

flighted on off stump, Bravo drops it down to point and runs. That was seriously tight, Kayes raced in, took a little time to throw it at the keeper. Could've underarmed it. Ramdin was short of his ground, but the target wasn't hit
good length ball on the pads, picked away wide of long-on
tucked away in front of square leg for another single
pushed down to mid-on, who is perched on the circle. Easy single taken to make West Indies' best partnership for any wicket
backed away and cuts to point
pushed through flatter on leg stump, Bravo punches down to long-on to retain strike on 99. Askes for a change of helmet, it would seem as the lights come on
defends with bat in front of pad on his leg stump
shorter and on the pads again, Bravo clips it through square leg and raises his bat rather nonchalantly as the bugles flare out
looped up, so much that it becomes a full toss and Ramdin strikes it down to long-off
jumps down the track, but realises it is too quick and flat to get under. Turned away through midwicket and they are quick enough to take a couple
down the track again as he taps the ball to long-on
fires in a yorker on leg stump, Ramdin spots it just in time
skips down and clips the length ball to short midwicket

hammered! This time he gets to the pitch as the bowler finally bowls one fuller. Full swing of the arms as Bravo sends it into orbit. That is the 15th six of the innings, the most West Indies have hit in an ODI
pulls his length back and Bravo is content with a punch to long-off
drilled to long-on and now this partnership has become the best for the third wicket in all ODIs
saw the batsman feigning to come down the track, Gazi fired it wide outside off, well past Bravo's reach so he directed his efforts to get back in his crease
pushed down the ground off the back foot
pushed through on off, Bravo stays deep in his crease and runs it off the open face to short third man
fired in on the pads, Ramdin went for a slog sweep but he didn't have enough room
yorks himself as he dances down to a fuller, flatter ball. Think he also jammed his boot with the bat
that time he made sure there was enough distance between bat and ball to enable a powerful golf swing! Sails 101 metres over deep midwicket
looks like that's going to be the norm for Bravo, uses his feet to get to the pitch but he miscues a slog to deep square leg. Manages to make amends with his running though
fired full on off stump, Bravo comes down and drills to long-off to bring up the highest partnership against Bangladesh for any wicket
jumps down, but the ball is flatter and the length is shorter. So he adjusts into a cut behind point
goes down the track and tickles a length ball through to long-on
flighted and pushed down leg, Bravo tries to use the pace and nudge it away fine, but can't
races down to confound the bowler, who offers up a big full toss. Goes off balance as he tries to cane it. The miscue lands well short of long-off

slows it up as he sees the batsman advancing and that makes Bravo miscue, to point. He was running out of juice anyway, which was why he tried to hit everything out of the park. Terrific innings from Lil B
picked away into the on side to get off the mark
lunges down to defend a flighted ball outside off
seeks the yorker just outside off, just misses the mark as Ramdin digs it out to long-off
full toss, Pollard deals with it with disdain, flicking over square leg. Effortlessly done, even with the ball nearly over waist high. But he was standing well out of his crease
pushed full in at the pads, Pollard works it away through square leg

that's fallen short of the keeper! Mushfiqur seems to have injured himself as well! This was a good length, ball, a slower one. Takes the outside edge and dies as the keeper dived forward. Gets a bad bounce and the ball strikes his left eyebrow and forehead. Medical personnel rush out to tend to him, but he seems to be okay. Grimacing aside
change of pace again, but it's a touch too short. Ramdin was originally fooled and gets the pull off the toe. He was hitting with only one hand too, but it ends up a one-bounce four
away she goes! Clatters into the roof over long-on as he takes  care of a length ball on middle and off. Cleared that front leg and gave it the old heave-ho
flat and fast on the stumps, Pollard just about manages to keep his stumps intact after backing away to cut. Might have skidded on and stayed a touch low
through the fingers of long-off as he was leaping up! This was flighted on off stump, Ramdin moved outside leg to hammer it flat and hard down the ground. The fielder jumps, but did it too early
scythed through the covers. Same technique as he moves outside leg and drills a fuller ball from off stump to the cover boundary
flighted on middle and leg, nurdled away to long-on

holes out at long-on, but there are no celebrations, prompting a few people to doubt if the catch was taken. This was flighted on middle and leg, Pollard wound up for the big hit but didn't put enough muscled behind it.
pushed through on off stump, punched down to long-off
that's a low full toss on off stump, Sammy swings a little too hard and slices it to mid-off
full on off stump, Ramdin scoops it up in the air but it bounces short of long-off
width on offer and Sammy tucks into it. Almost down on one knee as he flays a length ball over the covers
full and a touch wide of off stump, Ramdin did himself in by moving away outside leg and reached it only with the toe of the bat. Can't beat extra cover
goes the the wide yorker again and stymies Sammy who can only dab it through to point
length again and Ramdin smacks it down the ground to long-on. Wanted a couple, but Sammy hadn't caught on to it
offers up a low full toss outside off, Sammy drills it to long-off
full and a shade outside off, Ramdin, having played so well hammering the ball down the ground, goes for a scoop behind his left shoulder. Impact on the pad was outssde off to foil Mortaza's appeal
good yorker, wide out off stump. Sammy goes for a hoick which ends up an inside edge onto pad
pitched up outside off with plenty of pace as Sammy is late on this one as he looks to smash this out of St Kitts

going for the wide yorker but gets his length slightly off as this is converted into a low full toss outside off, but luckily for Al-Amin, Sammy struggles to get this away as this ends up spooning high over to deep extra-cover, who is able to get under it to take a smart catch. West Indies looking to hit out in these final overs as Bangladesh seek desperately for a modicum of control on the scoring rate
right in the blockhole this time as Ramdin is able to dig it out and scamper a single
overpitched from Al-Amin but just outside off as Bravo helps this down to long on for a single
slogs the slower delivery away but picks out Nasir Hossain at long on

slower ball outside off as Bravo looks to dab this down to short third man for a quick single but immediately sends back Ramdin as he hits this a bit too well to the fielder. Ramdin is able to make it back to his end before any trouble ensues.
just drilled away through the covers off the back foot with the most minimal of footwork
slower yorker on middle and leg as Bravo picks it well enough to help ease it down to midwicket
honing in on that blockhole as Ramdin gets nice and low to work this away down to long on, running the first one hard enough to make it two

when it is your day, it is your day, as Ramdin clears his front leg to just smash Mortaza over extra-cover for another massive six. His eye is too good at this point not to miss out on such filth. Mortaza unlucky to get his yorker wrong
another full delivery, but on the pads, as Ramdin flicks this one in front of square, running hard enough for the pair to complete two
nice length ball on middle and leg which Ramdin is able to get under and cart over to deep midwicket to retain the strike for the next over
that record attempt is looking a little less likely as he swats this length ball down to long on for a single
punches this one down the ground to long off for a single

and he is going to finish level with BC Lara on 169 as his blinder of an innings finally comes to an end as he looks to clear Al-Amin, who is looking for the blockhole once more, but just can't get enough on it to clear the fielder stationed just before the rope, as this one flies directly to him. Ramdin is kicking himself, but he has more than done his job today for his country. Has really set up West Indies beautifully here

and his stay at the crease ends as quickly as it began as he pretty much follows Ramdin to the pavilion with a similar-looking shot that is picked up by the same, exact fielder, as the one Ramdin found before, and all of a sudden Al-Amin is now on a hat-trick with two balls left
decides to go for the slower ball outside off but Bravo is just not able to get anything on it as the ball carries behind to the keeper
another peach of a slower ball, again outside off, as Bravo swings for the fences, but can't connect.

inn2.comm: short of length delivery just outside off stump, Tamim defends off the back foot
keeps it close around the off stump, Tamim defends from the crease
clipped away off his pads to the left of mid on
down the leg side, should have been put away but Anamul gently tucks it into the leg side

perfect start for the West Indies, this straightens off a good length and forces Anamul to hang his bat. The edge sails through to second slip. He was rooted to the crease and felt for the ball, which led to his downfall
banged in short first ball, Kayes goes after it with a hook. Not quite in control as it falls short of deep fine leg
short and wide, Tamim holds his balance and slaps it to point
shortish on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
shortish and angled across him, Tamim taps it behind point with an open face
changes it up with a fuller length in the off stump corridor, Tamim looks for the on-the-up drive, but is beaten

Oh my, oh my! That is an absolute stunner. Roach almost defied gravity for a moment as he hung in mid-air, stuck out his right hand, and plucked a mistimed pull at mid on to complete a mesmerising catch. Fantastic athleticism on display here as Bangladesh go two down very early in the piece
good length ball on and around off stump, defended solidly
stands up tall and punches this short ball outside off through to deep point
brings the batsman forward with a fuller length on off stump, safely blocked
back of a length and outside off, left alone
left alone outside of off as this shapes away
this one has come in back quite a bit since pitching outside off, as Mushfiqur is struck in line, but the umpire is not interested as this was pitching outside off. Good ball there by Holder
good length delivery on the off stump, Rahim defends and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
on the front foot to defend this short of a length ball on and around off
keeps him on the back foot as Mushfiqur dabs this one outside off past the slips to third man
nice and full from Ravi as Tamim is solid in defense
cramps him for room as this pitches on middle and leg, with Tamim looking to go leg side, but fails to do so
on the back foot as this is punched away towards mid on by Tamim
again on the pads as Tamim is unable to tuck this away on the leg side, instead finding the fielder at square leg
short ball and slanting down the leg side as Mushfiqur gets a nice deflection on this to tap this round the corner past the fielder at deep fine leg for a boundary
better line from Holder as this one gets some nice carry just outside off before shaping in on its way to the keeper
too full and on the pads as this is flicked away to the deep fine leg fielder for a single
right in the slot as Tamim gets nice and low to drive this one through extra-cover for a wonderfully timed boundary. Was nicely balanced in the execution
pulls back the length here next ball as Tamim reads it in time before adjusting his shot to open the face to allow for the dab down to third man
short of a length outside off and coming into the batsman as Mushfiqur stands tall in defense

what a ball from Rampaul! pitches this on middle as this one comes back in sharply, cutting Tamim in half as it goes through to the keeper. Ball must have thudded into the pads before passing through as the bowler and keeper go up for an appeal, but the umpire is not having any of it
bang on the money once more as all Tamim can do is defend off the back foot
plays this short of a length ball on off with soft hands, but can't sneak a single on the off side as the fielders swoop in

this one has hit the pads again off Tamim as Rampaul goes up for yet another appeal as the ball carries behind to Ramdin, who takes a good low catch, as he rolls to his left, but the umpire is still not interested
in a similar channel as before, perhaps a touch wider, as Tamim has learned his lesson and looks to get out of the way
displays how to play an orthodox back foot defence as this one is defended back to the bowler
short of a length outside off as Mushfiqur guides this one down to third man
drills this one straight to the fielder at cover as Tamim continues to look for the gaps on the off side
short of a length which is defended off the back foot to the off side

too short from Holder as Tamim rocks back to pull him high over midwicket for a one-bounce four. That is a much-welcome boundary for Bangladesh, who really need to get the scoring rate up if they are going to make a decent fist of this chase
once again short from Holder as Tamim looks for the pull through midwicket, but can't get enough behind it to beat the inner field on the leg side
Mushfiqur content to defend this length ball just outside off behind to the man at backward point
short and punished by Tamim as he gets onto the back foot quickly to pull Rampaul through square leg for four
straighter from Rampaul as Tamim defends back to the bowler
presents a nice, straight bat to the bowler as this is defended to the left of him
this just sits up for Tamim to punish as he is given yet another short ball which is given the treatment, this time pulled to midwicket for four

this time shifts the line to angle across him, as Tamim looks to spear this away through the off side, but at the last moment takes one hand of the bat as he realises it is not going to go very far, with the ball eventually fielded by backward point
defends this last ball with soft hands to bring the over to an end
gets nice and forward to this length ball just outside off

Mushfiqur in complete control of this as he gets forward before opening the face to run this down through third man for a much-needed boundary, beating the second slip as he looked to stop it with his left hand
short and wide but Mushfiqur is unable to make Holder pay as he slaps this away straight to cover
slanting ball from outside off as Mushfiqur gets solidly behind the line
uses his feet expertly to shimmy down the track before scything the ball through the covers, with the ball blazing away through the outfield to the boundary rope. No one moved a muscle
this time looks to tuck Holder away to the leg side, but Tamim is sent back soon after when Mushfiqur sees how quickly mid on had latched onto the ball
on the front foot straightaway to this length ball on and around off
length ball just outside off and angling across the batsman as Tamim shoulders arms
a tad fuller from Rampaul as this is defended away to the off side
Tamim gets nice and low as he defends this length ball towards point

really lucky break for Tamim as he advances down the track, noticing that Rampaul has dropped his length, and then realises the ball is moving across him, so he is able to get some bat on it and ramp this over the slips to the third man boundary

this time it is Rampaul's turn as he drops it even shorter, and sees Tamim coming down, so this time he shifts his line a little wider, with Tamim unable to get anything on it as the ball flies behind to the keeper
pitched right up and in the slot as Mushfiqur gets forward before pushing this past the bowler to the straight boundary
fullish length again from Bravo which Mushfiqur eases down to long on
goes round the wicket as Tamim gets forward before playing this with soft hands to the off side, but Mushfiqur doesn't want to take the risky single, so the left-hander heads back to his crease
Bravo tests him with a bouncer, and clearly he hasn't been watching closely enough as Tamim accepts this gleefully with another mighty pull to midwicket for four
tries the slower bouncer this time as Tamim picks it early, but after advancing down the track realises he is not going to get anything on this, so weaves away to let the ball through to the keeper
short down the leg side, glanced away to fine leg
hint of swing to this slower ball just outside off as Tamim is early on the shot, looking for the punch through the covers
length ball on middle which is defended away with soft hands to the leg side
honing in on the hips of Tamim as this is whisked away square off the wicket on the leg side
short ball on the leg stump as Tamim whips this off the pads behind square
length ball coming into the batsman as Mushfiqur looks to play leg side, but the ball instead is mishit to the off side, but far from any danger
splayed well down the leg side as the umpire confirms the decision for wide
this time pitched up in the blockhole as Mushfiqur is able to get behind this one successfully
looking for the drive through the covers to this fuller one just outside off and going across him, but can't get it past the fielder at silly mid off
drops his length considerably as he pitches on leg, with Tamim able to work him round the corner for a single

overpitched and outside off as Bravo tests him out with a slower ball which Mushfiqur just manages to get under, but doesn't quite get the distance he sought, with sweeper cover coming round to field the ball
pure fodder from Pollard, pitching on leg, as Tamim just paddles this round the corner off the back foot to help it to the deep fine leg boundary
fuller this time, on and around middle and off, as Tamim steers a single towards mid off
eases this length ball down to long on for one
driven straight to mid off by Tamim as the over comes to an end
length ball outside off which Mushfiqur looks to get past short third man
displays the straightest of bats as this is defended back to the bowler
shortish length outside off which Mushfiqur is keen on defending to the off side
back of a length outside off which is punched away to sweeper cover for a single
tucked away off the pads for a comfortable single behind square
fuller ball on middle and leg as Mushfiqur helps this one down to mid on
slower ball outside off as Mushfiqur looks for the crunching drive through the covers, but can't beat the inner ring

fuller one on middle and leg which strikes Mushfiqur on the inside of his left pad as Bravo goes up for a hopeful shout, but this one was definitely sliding down leg, so the umpire is unmoved. Good decision in the end
Tamim's eyes must have lit up at this one as he is given width outside off to free his arms as he blitzes one behind square to the third man boundary for four
proceeds to sensibly dab a single down to long on
Mushfiqur looking to get one past mid off, but can't beat the fielder
drives this along the ground to long on
starts off with the straighter one which is played back to the bowler
pitched up and outside off as Mushfiqur gets low to sweep this one from outside off, striking this firmly at the man at silly mid on, who is unable to get a hand on it as it bursts through him
gets forward straightaway as this is defended away with soft hands
once again rooted to the crease as this is defended to the off side
shifts the line to more middle and leg as Mushfiqur is able to find the single down to long on
Tamim content to crouch low and neutralise the threat of this final ball before the drinks break
good carry for Roach as this one is pitched outside off, with Mushfiqur a little surprised by the bounce on offer as he defends to the off side
in the slot as Mushfiqur drills this one straight to the fielder at cover. Gayle is telling Mushfiqur it should have gone on the full to him so he could take a catch. Wishful thinking Chris
straight as an arrow from Roach and defended right back to the bowler as well
Mushfiqur looking to give Roach the charge, and he is not having any of it as he drops his length to take advantage of Mushfiqur's height (or lack of in this case)
gets nice and tall as he whips this off his pads for one
full and on the pads as Tamim is able to tickle this down the leg side past Ramdin to the fine leg boundary
tossed up outside off as Mushfiqur looks to his free his arms and dab this past short third man, but can't
presses forward to defend Narine to the leg side
pitches one just outside off which has Mushfiqur coming forward slightly before employing the paddle sweep to help this fine down the leg side
uses the knuckleball this time as Mushfiqur is able to cover the line efficiently
on the front foot straightaway as he fends away to the off side
once again uses the knuckleball outside off as Mushfiqur defends to point
short of a length and slanting across as Tamim runs this one down to third man
overpitched and lucky not to be punished as Mushfiqur drives this straight to the fielder at mid off

fullish length on the stumps as Mushfiqur was looking to dab this on the leg side, but gets an inside edge onto his pads. Tamim has already set off for the single, and Mushfiqur follows his partner's call as he scampers to the other end
Tamim looking to drive on the up through the covers, but plays a tad early as this one inside edges onto him

in the zone just outside off as Roach is guilty of overpitching, but Tamim hasn't struck this as well as he would like as he finds the fielder at sweeper cover. Doesn't prevent him though from reaching a 26th ODI fifty
short of length delivery on the off stump, tucked away to backward square leg
Flighted on middle, Mushfiqur is forward to nudge it to midwicket
Nicely tossed up and he checks his drive, getting an inside edge onto the pads and then back to the bowler
Reminiscent of the last ODI, but the finger doesn't go up. This was a touch shorter and went through hstraight as Mushfiqur attempted a cut
Straying on the pads and he clips to deep fine leg
draws him forward as Tamim defends with bat in front of pad
lunges into a slog sweep, had to reach out for it though with Narine giving the ball a lot more air than the Bangladesh spinners. Falls safely away from the deep square leg fielder
that's a good short ball, angling in at the right-hander. Mushfiqur ducked, rather late, took his eyes off the ball and evaded it a little less than competently
dug in short again, but this time he is able to rock back and pull to deep midwicket
goes down the ground, but Roach follows his moving down leg side and cramps him up. Skewed to mid-off
picked away off middle and leg as he flicks from the crease
too short, and that sat up for Tamim to pull. Went at it a little too hard perhaps as he bottom-edges it through to deep midwicket
the short-ball ploy is not working. This time it is Mushfiqur who benefits as he gets back and pulls in front of square. Sweetly struck
flighted just outside, Tamim is forwrard to block
leans forward and drives along the turf to long-off
picked away off his knees as Mushfiqur plays with the turn
stays back, makes a little room and chops a shortish ball to the left of point to raise the hundred
pushed through and this good length ball turns away, Mushfiqur rides it through to deep point
chose the wrong ball to cut. That was ducking back in at him, it was the knuckle ball that skids off the turf, takes the bottom edge and crashes into the sticks
shuffles across and glances a shortish delivery to deep fine leg
stands up tall to defend a back of a length delivery on middle and off
fuller and teasing outside off, Mominul falls for it. So close to gaining the outside edge with the batsman rooted to the crease
prefers to stay on the back foot and the length enables him to do so as he pulls, albeit not off the middle, through square leg
fuller on middle and leg, Mushfiqur stays back and turns it away around the corner on the leg side
full and wide outside off, eased through the covers as he leans on the front foot
flighted on middle, Mominul turns it into the leg side with a closed face
steers the fuller ball turning away from him to short third man
hits a good length and extracts some turn, which defeats Mominul's flick and raps him on the pads, impact outside leg though
waits for the turn off a shorter ball and chops it to deep point
plays him from the crease after reading the turn on the ball off the deck. Defended
a little more bounce than Mushfiqur expected as he got forward to a flighted ball on middle. Adjusted well though to drop it into the leg side
fuller and outside off, Mominul checks his drive into the covers
shortish and steered across the left-hander who has a go and misses. Could have been a four, could have been an outside edge
finds a good length just outside off, Mominul blocks with an angled blade
full and just a shade outside off, Mominul leans into a drive to cover

one flash too many and this time the outside edge is thick enough to carry to first slip. They've been probing outside his off stump ever since he got to the crease, he's had problems there in the recent past and has become his downfall again
full on middle, meets it with the full face of the bat to end a wicket-maiden

huge appeal for leg before as Narine turns a good length ball quite sharply to hit Mushfiqur on the pads. The bowler wants a review, but it seems the captain isn't too keen. Mushfique was stuck on his crease but may have been hit a little too high
goes back to tap a shortish ball that comes into him to point
gets forward on off stump taps it with a closed face towards mdiwicket
worked away to long-on as he uses his wrists to keep the ball down
beaten all ends up as he blocks down the wrong line. This was the one that pitched on a good length and veered away
stays back to defend a good length ball on middle
full and fired a little too far down the leg side
sliced past point, he opened the face on impact to place the ball to the right of the fielder inside the circle
this is a slower ball just outside off, offcutter it seemed. Mushfiqur dabs at it to third man and secures a hard-earned half-century
fuller on middle and leg, he turns it to midwicket
ventures forward and blocks on middle
seeks the yorker around the off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
another offcutter, this time Mushfiqur's timing deserts him as he looks to cut through point
a little too much flight there and Mahmudullah scoops it to long leg
gets forward to block a fuller ball on the stumps
jumps down and yorks himself, can't beat Gayle on his left
fired through on middle and leg, drilled back at the bowler again
nips down the ground and smokes an extra cover drive all along the ground. Delicious shot as he got to the pitch and unleashed some impressive power
a little too straight and Mushfiqur turns it around the corner
lovely stroke again as he brings down the full face of the bat on a slightly overpitched delivery on off stump
shortish on middle and off makes Mahmudullah stand up on his toes to defend. Aha, but Holder has overstepped, so we will have a free hit

it short, it slower and Mahmudullah has slammed it to deep square leg. Hit it quite hard, though he lost control of the stroke. Simmons is the man there and he catches it but his back-pedalling meant he had to throw the ball back in play
shortish and outside off, Mushfiqur goes for a cut to third man but there was a little more bounce than he expects
this hugs close to the ground on its way through to the keeper. Another offcutter grips the pitch and stays quite low to foil the cut again
steers a shortish delivery to point
sends down a yorker, one with lesser pace than usual, but Mushfiqur and his dead bat are wise to it
picked away through square leg, Mushfiqur spotted an easy single but Mahmudullah was ball-watching. Nearly a mix-up but there was no one around to capitalise
a little shorter on leg stump and Mushfiqur pulls it to deep fine leg
jumps down the track and turns the flighted ball to midwicket
gets forward to tickled a fuller ball on middle to square leg
stays back and whips a flatter ball from his stumps to deep fine leg
cramps him up around the off stump with a shorter ball that nips in at him. Mahmudullah goes for a pull, but gets only an inside edge
good length ball on and around off stump, defended off the front foot
full and angled in on middle and leg, Mushfiqur whips it to deep midwicket
shortish and wide outside off, tapped away to deep third man
pulls the pace off this fuller ball on off stump, Mushfiqur defends it
another slower, ball, this time shorter in length. The batsman gets up on his toes to chop it into the off side
fired down the leg side as he expected Mushfiqur to use his crease. All he did was stand and watch it sneak behind his legs
good length ball cramping him for room, Mushfiqur tries to flick it but misses
nips down the track to nudge the flighted ball to mid-on

that was a wide, but it might have been a ploy too. Ramdin shows his skills behind the stumps, whipping the bails off in a trice as he collects a fuller, quicker ball down leg. Mushfiqur seems to have overbalanced, but has he made his ground? He has. Good, swift footwork
flighted outside off, Mushfiqur drives to the left of mid-off
uses the angle as he glances the fuller ball off the pads to deep fine leg
stays back and taps a good length ball to midwicket
this is full, fast and curling in at the base of the stumps. Mahmudullah could do little more than keep it out of his stumps
worked away to long-on as he goes full and straight again
too short and too slow to bother the batsman who rocked back and pulled it to the midwicket boundary. Think he got enough to clear the boundary ropes
seeks the yorker on middle and leg, but doesn't get it full enough. Whipped away to deep midwicket
he has lost his length here, offers up a full toss that is nearly over waist high. Mushfiqur though has got on the front foot and heaved it straight of midwicket. Wonders why that wasn't a no-ball
another smart stroke as he meets a fuller ball on middle and leg with a wristy flick to long-on
flings down a half-tracker down leg, Mushfiqur collects an easy wide
gets across to off stump and finds short fine leg with a flick
wants to make room outside leg, but the bowler outsmarts him by bowler fuller and quicker. Steered to point
fuller and outisde off, he drags it to square leg with a sweep
stays back and works a shortish ball into the leg side with a closed face
a little more flight on this as Mushfiqur flicks from the crease to midwicket
backs away and taps a shortish ball to the left of backward point and that will be drinks
full and on the pads as this is flicked behind to the man at deep fine leg
short of a length outside off as Mahmudullah gets forward to defend
played with soft hands towards the man at point, but has timed it a bit too well to allow for the quick single
pitched up just outside off as Mahmudullah directs this towards mid on, but still can't find the run
sprays this one well down the leg side, called wide by the umpire
overpitched from Rampaul as this is drilled back past the bowler to the straight boundary, with long off coming round to intercept it
similar as the previous delivery, with Pollard back into the thick of things at long off to field the ball
looks to whip this off the pads but finds the square leg fielder
slower one that is pitched short outside off as Mushfiqur leans into this before opening the face to dab it down to third man
waits for the turn on this one before looking to flick this off his hips to the leg side
gets deep into the crease to try and cut away Narine past point, but the fielder is on top of it
spinning sharply into Mushfiqur as he looks to tuck this away leg side
flighted on and around off as Mushfiqur employs the slog sweep to good effect to bring up the fifty partnership between these two
gets the kind of length he can get under as this one, pitched just outside off, as this is carted away just in front of the square leg boundary for four
excellent piece of fielding! Full and just outside off stump, Mahmudullah drills it hard but Roach dives to his left at mid off and makes a fine save before firing in a throw
bang on the money as this one comes in to crush Mushfiqur on the toes. Waqar would be proud
once again bowls in a similar channel as Mushfiqur misses this one entirely going for the big swing and miss down long on
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler

and Mushfiqur's vigil finally comes to an end as he looks for some quick runs over square leg, hitting this fuller delivery from Rampaul to Darren Sammy, who takes a good, safe catch. With this wicket, West Indies will feel even more secure in their position
waits for the ball to spin into him before tucking away Narine behind square on the leg side
tossed up outside off as Hossain is given that little bit of width to drive this square off the wicket for a couple
defended manfully by Mahmudullah on the off side
quicker, flatter one from Narine which is defended back to the bowler
waits for the spin once more before deciding to employ his front foot defense
covers the line for the one that spins the other way as this is pitched on a middle stump line. Mahmudullah thinks it best to defend this one back to Narine
begins with a nice bouncer outside off which has Nasir weaving away for safety. Could have maybe had a flash at it over the slips?
pitches this up on the same line as Nasir gets forward to defend
similar delivery and result as the previous ball. Bangladesh looking to get through all their overs here, regardless of the match situation

another bouncer, this time slanting down the leg side, as Nasir shimmies over to try and flick this past Mushfiqur, but fails to get any bat on it. It's not all bad news though, as the umpire calls a wide

yet another bouncer and it really looked on first instance as though Nasir got a bit of bat on it after stepping over to create space and play the pull. They go for the appeal but the umpire is not interested, instead calling for the wide
this time up in the blockhole from Rampaul as this is defended ably by Nasir
drops his length this time outside off to more a shortish variety as Nasir fails to get away Rampaul through the off side
finishes off the over with a bouncer which Nasir is all too satisfied to duck under and allow through to the keeper
on the front foot as Mahmudullah nudges Narine to the leg side
pitched on middle and leg as Mahmudullah is into position quickly to lift Narine over deep midwicket for a boundary, beating the fielder stationed on the boundary
shifts his line more to off and middle as Mahmudullah does well to cover for any turn
slightly flatter from Narine on a similar line as he is able to whisk him away down the leg side
Nasir a bit late on this one turning into him as he looked for a way to nurdle this down the leg side
rushes Nasir slightly as he backs away to try and create room to cut Narine through the off side. In the end, the ball doesn't get away too far
short and wide and Roach is lucky he wasn't punished. Nasir ends up hitting this to the man at cover
short of a length and slanting into Nasir as he gets into position to pull Roach through midwicket, with deep midwicket intercepting the ball on the boundary
helped off the pads to the fielder at deep fine leg for an easy single

good slower ball by Roach, this one well outside off, as Mahmudullah is guilty of following this one as he goes for a half-hearted cut, hoping to get this through the slip region, but instead manages a thick outside edge which is taken by Ramdin. West Indies four wickets away now from wrapping this up
Gazi really late on this one as he goes for a flash outside off
finishes the over with a slower bouncer which Gazi has no clue about as he ducks under it
pushed off the back foot to mid on. Nasir runs the first one hard, allowing him to return for the second in quick time
looking for the expansive drive through the covers, but instead finds the man at mid off
pads this latest delivery on middle and off as the West Indians go up for an appeal for LBW, but not given
flatter from Narine, and going down leg, as Nasir tries to get this away on the leg side
short outside off as Nasir is given room to free his arms, but is late on the ball
whipped away off the pads behind square as Nasir retains strike
shortish length outside off which is slapped away to the cover fielder
short again, this time slanting across, as Nasir just clips this behind to deep fine leg
brings it up a little outside off as Sohag is early on his front foot to defend
on the front foot straightaway as this is worked away with soft hands to the leg side, allowing Gazi to get off the mark with a quick single, beating the throw at his own end without much issue
short of a length and angling down the pads as Nasir is into position quickly to pull him behind square past the deep fine leg fielder to the boundary
looking for the blockhole as Nasir gets a smidgen of his bat on it to run this one down to third man for a useful boundary
flighted delivery outside off stump, Gazi lofts it over mid-off and there's no one in the deep to prevent the four
tries to get away Gayle through the leg side, but is beaten down the pads
pitched up by Gayle and Gazi makes him pay as he hammers him back down the ground, beating both long on and off to the boundary
gets onto the back foot before trying to whip away Gayle through the leg side. The keeper goes for an appeal for caught behind, but the umpire is not having any of it
down the leg side again, played from the crease
Gazi was early into the sweep, the ball goes off the back of the bat. Ramdin tries to grab the ball but it evades him
low full toss on the stumps, tucked away to backward square leg
slower ball on middle which Nasir delays his pull for at the last minute to get behind square on the leg side
Gazi gets his front leg out of the way, but ends up slapping this straight to cover
slower ball outside off stump, Gazi had no clue about it
pitched up on the pads as Gazi clips this one to the man at deep midwicket
slower ball, well wide of off stump, as Nasir saw this one early to wait on it to come to him before freeing his arms to scythe this away through the covers for a boundary
fired on the leg stump, turned by Sohag to backward square leg
tucked away neatly to backward square leg by Nasir

floated by Gayle on middle as Sohag comes charging down the track before lifting him gracefully over long on, but didn't quite middle it as the fielder at long on, who probably saw it late, was unable to get to the ball on time as it dropped just in front of him
nudged away by Gazi to deep midwicket for a single
on the back foot as he looks to utilise the cut, but can't get it past point
eased down to long on for a single as Nasir retains the strike

and he strikes straightaway, taking the useful wicket of Nasir as he looked to deposit Rampaul back over his head into the stands, but only succeeds in lifting this one high and handsome, with Kemar Roach coming round from long on to complete the catch

looking for the yorker as this one is speared on middle and leg, with Mortaza going for the big heave and ho, but not connecting, as this one thuds into his back pad, with Rampaul going up for the shout, but this was definitely missing leg
low full toss on the off stump, lofted to long off
gets his bat out in time to defend this before setting off for a quick single, which the pair make safely in the end
short of length delivery outside off stump, Gazi backs away and misses the cut
just a bit of shape back into the right-hander on this good length delivery, glanced to fine leg
Gazi manages to whip this one through deep midwicket for a single
tossed up on middle and leg as Mortaza clears his front leg to slog sweep Gayle behind square to the deep fine leg boundary
once again looks for the big hit over the leg side, but doesn't quite get enough on it. Still manages to sneak a single though
dances down to this one floated on leg, but Gazi ends up hitting this behind square on the leg side
lifts this awkwardly past short fine leg with one hand on the bat. Very agricultural from Mortaza
full on the leg stump, flicked to backward square leg
follows the batsman as he looks to back away to create room. Ends up digging this one out successfully

up in the blockhole as Sohag gets some willow on it before setting off for a quick single as the ball rolls to the off side. The throw coming in manages to hit the stumps at the non-striker's, but his bat didn't come down in time, and he would have been given out if someone had appealed, but no one appealed, and that is a lesson learned young'uns . Mortaza fortunate to get away with that one
plays this one from the crease

bowled 'im! full and fast and on target and all Rampaul needed was for Gazi to miss, which he does as he looks to blast this out of St Kitts. Gazi, however, is unmoved as they await the no-ball replay. Rampaul looks safe, but only just, as he has a little bit of his boot behind the line upon impact
going round the wicket to Razzak as this is delivered up and near the off stump, with Razzak playing back towards the bowler
finishes off his ten-over spell with a beautiful back of a length ball which shapes away upon pitching as this flies to the keeper behind
not the best start if that is their aim as Mortaza creates room by backing away to this ball pitched up to him as he smashes this over the head of Gayle for a six over long on
what a time to bowl a wide! The keeper couldn't do much about it as it was fired down the leg side
misses the slog sweep and gets hit on the pad, Razzak wants the run but Mortaza says no
almost yorker-length from Gayle as this one is drilled to long on
just stand and deliver as Razzak just bludgeons this through the line through extra-cover for four
bowls one which spins away as Razzak once again looks to clear the field, but is late on it as it spins away
slaps this one pitched wide of off stump down to long on to bring the match to an end
